feed.title: RoadToIT |
feed.subtitle: A blog about IT in Paris Region

entry.title: Station F
entry.content:
Designed by Xavier Niel (creator of 42), STATION F is the largest startup incubator in the world, with several thousand startups, dozens of programs and a presence of major US companies on campus. By far the most impressive and developed incubator !

The Info Box ¬†
üè¢ Incubator Name STATION F
üåê Location Paris, France
üî¢ Startups incubated 1000+ startups
üè∞ Size 34 000 m¬≤
üõç The ‚ÄúPetit plus‚Äù Fighters Program is offered free of charge for one year to entrepreneurs
who have not completed a course in high schools.
üíµ Price Fighters Program : Free
Founders Program : 195 ‚Ç¨/month

Inaugurated in 2017 after 4 years of work, Station F is not only a large building hosting thousands of startups, it is also a building full of stories. Built in the 1930s, it was a freight hall belonging to SNCF, the French train company. For a long time, this building, called Halle Freyssinet, thus served as professional hangars, until its acquisition in 2013 by investor Xavier Niel (Iliad, Scaleway, Free, 42) and the City of Paris.

The campus is amazing. It is very well placed, close to public transport, restaurants, cinemas and housing. It covers 34 000 m¬≤ and hosts a start-up area of more than 3000 workstations, a market, 26 international support and acceleration programs, event spaces and several food courts. You will find hundreds of apartments just ten minutes from the campus, with all the necessary equipment for housing.

A personal guided tour at STATION F for 'Road To IT' ‚úåÔ∏è

The place to be

I have to be honest: the first time you go to Station F, you are immediately impressed. Why ? Because you will not only find startups still unknown, but also what they call Mentorship Offices. These are individual or small group sessions with a manager (engineer, commercial, developer, design) of a large company, such as Google, Apple, Amazon Web Services (AWS) or even OVH. They are here only to help you understand how their services work and how you can make the most out of their solutions, and it‚Äôs clearly something unique !

Looking for something more advanced? Introducing Station F‚Äôs programs. There are currently two, and in truth they are exactly the same, with only one difference : the price. You will probably ask yourself (and you are right) why pay a program 195 ‚Ç¨ per month when you can get it for free ? The answer is in the name of the free program : Fighters program.

The Fighters Program provides free access to the Founders Program for killer entrepreneurs who simply have not had the same opportunities as the rest.

In other words, the program is intended for entrepreneurs who have not had the chance to pursue higher education or to obtain a degree in business school or engineering. It‚Äôs open to everyone no matter where you come from. I thought it was important to talk about this program which I consider very innovative.

And now, back to basics. Station F offers shared or closed offices (open all the time), an access to all restaurants/bars/cafeteria, but also to meeting rooms, Wi-Fi/LAN, printers, exclusive events with other high-level entrepreneurs and a tons of perks. In addition to this, you will find essential services and stuffs for startups : investment funds areas, a fab lab, 3D printers and public services.

When I was in Ireland, a lot of people asked me if paying the monthly fee was the only way to join Station F, well‚Ä¶ the answer is no. And you will understand why. ‚¨áÔ∏è

Power to entrepreneurs

An incubator would be nothing without its network of professionals, companies and entrepreneurs around the world, and Station F understood this from the beginning. In addition to the programs I presented above, Station F offers hundreds of programs designed with its partners, including digital leaders like Facebook and its Facebook Garage Paris.

Partner programs evolve over time and are often short-term programs. But it‚Äôs a great way to join the world of startups by being fully accompanied by an expert. The Facebook Garage Program is a great example, it‚Äôs a six-month program for startups whose value proposition comes from the use of personal data.

We work with innovative startups in Paris. We support their business models and help bring about better data protection processes.
‚Äì Facebook France

In other words, Facebook provides to these companies a mentoring and regular follow-up during the incubation period. This translates into workshops with Facebook teams, monthly meetings with managers and experts, and tips for quick professionalization.

But Facebook is not the only company offering this program, you will find hundreds of programs in different areas, such as communication (Havas Group, HEC, EDHEC), beauty-retail (L‚ÄôOr√©al, Veepee), video games (Ubisoft), media (TF1), finance (BNP Paribas), tech (Microsoft, Thales, Usine.IO) and others.

üíé Le + : If you go to Paris, what I can advise you is to plan a visit to Station F for free, you will not have access to all the HQ (confidentiality of projects) but it is a very cool experience, you will also discover the neighborhood and the proximity with other incubators (NUMA) or schools (Epitech, Efrei, EPITA).

üåê Contact üåê
STATION F
5 Parvis Alan Turing
75013 Paris
www.stationf.co/contact
entry.summary: Designed by Xavier Niel (creator of 42), STATION F is the largest startup incubator in the world, with several thousand startups, dozens of programs and a presence of major US companies on campus. By far the most impressive and developed incubator !

entry.title: AgoraNov
entry.content:
Founded more than 16 years ago, AgoraNov is one of the largest incubators in √éle-de-France and France with more than 300 incubated startups, including successful companies such as the advertising giant Criteo, the appointment doctor management app Doctolib or the world robotics giant Aldebaran (now SoftBank Robotics). The incubator is also sponsored by many universities and public companies around the country.

The Info Box ¬†
üè¢ Incubator Name AgoraNov
üåê Location Paris, France
üè∞ Size 2000 m¬≤
üî¢ Startups incubated 320+ incubated projects and 300+ startups created
üõç The ‚ÄúPetit plus‚Äù AgoraNov has incubated successful companies like
Criteo, Biophytis, Aldebaran, Doctolib and more.
üíµ Price NC

A key player in the entrepreneurship and innovation sector and launched 16 years ago, AgoraNov is a public incubator of startups with a strong technological identity. The incubator was founded by the UPMC University (now Sorbonne University, do not hesitate to read my full article about it), Paris-Dauphine University, ENS, ParisTech and INRIA ‚Äì and fully supported by the Ministry of Research and Higher Education, the √éle-de-France Region, the City of Paris and the European Social Fund.

In less than 20 years, AgoraNov has raised more than 500 million euros of private funds for more than 320 incubated projects and 300 companies in the areas of digital technology, healthcare, industry and ‚Äúgreentech‚Äù. On the 320 incubated projects, nearly 170 have been rewarded by the Ministry of Higher Education and Research of France.

Agoranov simultaneously supports some 60 startups that benefit from personalized support, the possibility of being hosted in the heart of Paris, an acceleration program and the expertise of a community of more than 300 startups, including some ‚Äúp√©pites‚Äù like Criteo and Doctolib.

A very selective and condensed program

One of the particularities of AgoraNov compared to its competitors is the very strong selection at the entrance with only 60 projects incubated per year over a period of 24 months.

To join AgoraNov, you have to fill out a very complete form presenting your project. The form will be validated or not by the AgoraNov team, you will then have to present your project to the Incubator Expert Committee and if your project is accepted, an agreement is signed between AgoraNov and your team. You will understand that an Olympic preparation is necessary to join AgoraNov !

What does AgoraNov bring ?

The AgoraNov program is specific to each company and each domain (hopefully) but in general, the incubator will bring personality coaching by an experienced team from different fields.

With this you will also have accommodation with closed or open offices in the heart of Paris, you will have an infrastructure of more than 2000m¬≤, including meeting rooms, open-spaces, workspaces, relaxation areas and a reception. You will of course be able to exchange with other companies present on the spot and benefit from targeted training sessions (meetings with partners, investors, industrialists or experts of the sector).

‚ÄúWe have an appetite for more technological projects, but as we are open to all sectors, it creates synergies between web start-ups and those that are more tech‚Äù
- David Argellies, Charg√© d‚Äôaffaires at AgoraNov.

If AgoraNov is distinguished from others by being a public incubator, it‚Äôs also a real creator of ‚ÄúFrench p√©pites‚Äù - these successful companies that we see more and more in our lives. And that‚Äôs just the beginning !

Le + : For the past few years, AgoraNov has been involved in the ‚ÄúStartups at School‚Äù project, which aims to bring school audiences and young innovative companies closer together in the context of educational projects conceived in various school subjects.

üåê Contact üåê
AgoraNov
96bis Boulevard Raspail
75006 Paris
courrier@agoranov.com
+ 33 (0)1 44 18 07 15
entry.summary: Founded more than 16 years ago, AgoraNov is one of the largest incubators in √éle-de-France and France with more than 300 incubated startups, including successful companies such as the advertising giant Criteo, the appointment doctor management app Doctolib or the world robotics giant Aldebaran (now SoftBank Robotics). The incubator is also sponsored by many universities and public companies around the country.

entry.title: La Ruche
entry.content:
La Ruche (hive in English) is a network of incubators dedicated to social innovation. Its action includes co-working, incubation, events, but also the establishment of large-scale partnerships allowing each actor or startup to give birth to his project or idea in the best conditions, be it at Paris, in the region or in the whole of France with different ‚Äúhives‚Äù.

The Info Box ¬†
üè¢ Incubator Name La Ruche
üåê Location Paris - Saint-Germain-en-Laye, France
üè∞ Size 3200 m¬≤
üî¢ Startups incubated 125 projects per year
üõç The ‚ÄúPetit plus‚Äù La Ruche offers an incubation program for women in tech,
called ‚ÄúLes Audacieuses‚Äù and member of the Tech for Good project
üíµ Price Starting at 145‚Ç¨/month

Launched 11 ago with the conviction that a responsible and collaborative society was possible, La Ruche offers a range of services for entrepreneurs and young startups, from incubation to growth through advice and co-working spaces in all France.

‚ÄúThe Place to Bee‚Äù

From Hackathons to half-day to several days trainings, La Ruche offers a range of support for entrepreneurs and startups. In 1 year, more than 125 projects were incubated with an 83% survival rate of incubated entrepreneurs in the first 3 years.

Regarding the workspaces, I will focus on HQs in √éle-de-France and Paris Region, but La Ruche also has workspaces in Bordeaux, Marseille, Saint-Nazaire, Montpellier and more.

With 3200m¬≤ dedicated to the positive economy and a terrace of more than 200m¬≤ in Paris, La Ruche welcomes project leaders driven by social entrepreneurship, digital technology and culture. You find an astonishing diversity among co-workers, such as entrepreneurs, associations, employees, teleworkers, self-employed and intrapreneurs. Each category has its own tariff range adapted to its needs.

Programs for all

La Ruche offers special rates for everyone, and offers 5 programs :

  • Closed offices (starting 1k‚Ç¨/month) with offices for up to 20 people, with a commitment of 6 months and unlimited access.
  • Full time program (starting at 350‚Ç¨/month) with unlimited access, a fixed office for 1 person and a 3-month commitment.
  • Half time program (starting at 235‚Ç¨/month) with an access 20 half-days (or 10 days per month), a fixed office for 1 person and a 2-month commitment.
  • Quarter time program (starting at 145‚Ç¨/month) with an access 10 half-days (or 5 days per month), a fixed office for 1 person and a 2-month commitment.
  • Full time company program (starting at 500‚Ç¨/month) with unlimited access and more.

Startups have free Internet, printer, an access to 9 meeting rooms, a 220m¬≤ terrace, a kitchen/sleep room, training sessions, an access to meeting-space for your public events and of course, national professionals from La Ruche‚Äôs network.

Le + : As a Paris Innovation certified incubator by the Paris City Hall, startups located in La Ruche can apply for a funding with Paris Innovation Amor√ßage funding program. Created to support the development of startups hosted in incubators labeled Paris Innovation, it is aimed at any innovative project in the seed or development phase. Do not hesitate to consult the detailed presentation of this program and to contact, as the case may be, the Paris Regional Office of Bpifrance √éle de France.

üåê Contact üåê
La Ruche¬Æ Paris
24 Rue de l‚ÄôEst
75020 Paris
paris@la-ruche.net
+33 (0)1 83 64 59 04
entry.summary: La Ruche (hive in English) is a network of incubators dedicated to social innovation. Its action includes co-working, incubation, events, but also the establishment of large-scale partnerships allowing each actor or startup to give birth to his project or idea in the best conditions, be it at Paris, in the region or in the whole of France with different ‚Äúhives‚Äù.

entry.title: NUMA
entry.content:
Not just an open space for entrepreneurs, NUMA is an international hub of more than 300 organizations, including CAC40 leaders and hundreds of startups. Training and follow-up are at the heart of NUMA‚Äôs philosophy.

The Info Box ¬†
üè¢ Incubator Name NUMA
üåê Location Paris, France
üî¢ Startups incubated 300
üõç The ‚ÄúPetit plus‚Äù NUMA offers a free open-space with bar on the ground floor
üíµ Price Free co-working space
Privatization of rooms from 1200‚Ç¨/day

It all started in 2000 with Silicon Sentier, an entrepreneur association with more than 180 partner companies. Their initial objective was to encourage meetings between entrepreneurs and to allow new projects to emerge and floor on the Next Big Thing. The idea was to design a network capable of promoting and facilitating the development of entrepreneurship at the national level, and that‚Äôs what became NUMA today.

NUMA is not only an open space for entrepreneurs or small businesses today, it‚Äôs a hub of more than 300 organizations, including CAC40 leaders and hundreds of startups - with a presence in Paris, Barcelona, Mexico, Toulouse, Berlin and even New York.

Not only an open-space

The first time I went to NUMA, it was just to have a place where to discuss professionally with other students, entrepreneurs and business leaders. I discovered a free space co-working on the ground floor, with possibility to rent different rooms for private meetings.

My biggest surprise was to discover the ‚Äúformations‚Äù. Today, the challenge is not only to master the technical aspect of a project but also the notions of management, ‚Äúintrapreneurship‚Äù, design thinking and digital marketing. And guess what? That‚Äôs exactly what NUMA offers. In fact, we understand quickly that we do not invest only in a HQ or a place to work, but in a long-term support of your project.

‚ÄúTo infinity and beyond‚Äù

Regarding the incubation program, NUMA brings its expertise to startups already on the market and having a consequent turnover, for 3.5 % equity participation. NUMA‚Äôs philosophy is based on the development of the startups‚Äô business and network, the implementation of a rigorous and effective methodology for executing their strategy as well as long-term support through a mentoring system with experts.

Looking for something fun to do there, to discover the atmosphere of NUMA ? Do not hesitate to visit ‚ÄúLa Cantine‚Äù, the first collaborative workspace created in √éle-de-France Region, where many celebrities have passed to make conferences and exchange with members, like Mark Zuckerberg.

üåê Contact üåê
NUMA Paris
39 Rue du Caire
75002 Paris
+33 (0)1 40 13 64 40
entry.summary: Not just an open space for entrepreneurs, NUMA is an international hub of more than 300 organizations, including CAC40 leaders and hundreds of startups. Training and follow-up are at the heart of NUMA‚Äôs philosophy.

entry.title: IncubAlliance
entry.content:
Incubator of the Paris-Saclay cluster since 2005, IncubAlliance‚Äôs main mission is to create bridges between startups, companies, labor and research experts within the Paris-Saclay campus, through support, training and hosting services for startups and education stakeholders.

The Info Box ¬†
üè¢ Incubator Name IncubAlliance
üåê Location Orsay, France
üè∞ Size NC
üî¢ Startups incubated 404 incubated projects and 310 startups created
üõç The ‚ÄúPetit plus‚Äù Incubated startups work closely
with universities and companies from Paris-Saclay HQ
üíµ Price NC

Located in the Paris-Saclay campus, a major hub of French innovation and the world‚Äôs 8th largest innovation cluster, IncubAlliance has been working for many years on the creation of innovative technology entrepreneurial projects at national and global level. In 2018, IncubAlliance incubated 42 new projects and 18 startups were created : that represents nearly 700 jobs for a survival rate of 95% (over 5 years), which is consistent.

This incubator is the result of many years of questioning about how higher education institutions (universities, engineering schools) should manage their postgraduate students who wanted to start their own business.

By integrating the Paris-Saclay technology cluster, incubated startups work closely with students from neighboring schools or partners, and benefit from the expertise of 15% of French public and private research.

Support for startups‚Ä¶

The IncubAlliance program for startups is simple and accurate :

  • Providing a 35-day training program where experts help fine-tune one‚Äôs project, in workshop format, before a startup is definitively launched (called GenesisLab).
  • Providing a 22-month support program, which includes coaching and group workshops, to steer startups toward their first product launch and sales (called Incub22).
  • Financing projects throughout the entire incubation period to cover external and outsourced services.
  • Giving an incubation program certification (recognized by France).
  • Offering shared or private accommodation for all teams in the Paris-Saclay HQ.
  • Proposing collaborators and experts from Paris-Saclay universities, companies or laboratories.

Customized offers ‚ÄúSur mesure‚Äù are of course available according to the needs of startups.

‚Ä¶And for companies

A developed company can also benefit from IncubAlliance‚Äôs advantages, such as :

  • Providing a privileged access to IncubAlliance‚Äôs services and the tech startup network.
  • Giving a complete excubation program specially designed for companies‚Äô and institutions‚Äô needs.
  • Providing the GenesisLab program described above.
  • Providing a 8-day program with an introduction to technological entrepreneurship with a project under way (called GenesisLight).
  • Organizing meet-ups between startups, companies and research institutions.

In addition to all this, some programs are eligible for professional training financing solutions. The funding comes mainly from the European Union, the √éle-de-France region and the Ministry of Higher Education of France. Regarding the cost, it depends on the needs of startups but on average, it amounts to about 7000‚Ç¨ on the entire program.

üåê Contact üåê
IncubAlliance Paris-Saclay
86 Rue de Paris
91400 Orsay
contact@incuballiance.fr
+33 (0)1 77 93 21 00
entry.summary: Incubator of the Paris-Saclay cluster since 2005, IncubAlliance‚Äôs main mission is to create bridges between startups, companies, labor and research experts within the Paris-Saclay campus, through support, training and hosting services for startups and education stakeholders.

entry.title: P√©pini√®re 27
entry.content:
With more than 100 startups incubated in a general and multi-disciplinary ecosystem, P√©pini√®re 27 is a Parisian incubator offering both a flexible hosting and support services, but also a rich and inspiring infrastructure, like a natural greenhouse where knowledge flourishes.

The Info Box ¬†
üè¢ Incubator Name P√©pini√®re 27
üåê Location Paris, France
üè∞ Size 3500 m¬≤ of offices, 100 m¬≤ of common areas
+ gym room, relaxation area, ‚Ä¶
üî¢ Startups incubated 100
üõç The ‚ÄúPetit plus‚Äù P√©pini√®re 27 is labeled ‚ÄúParis Innovation‚Äù by the City of Paris
+ Access to the ‚ÄúPIA‚Äù (Paris Innovation Amor√ßage) funding program
üíµ Price Starting at 250‚Ç¨/month

What‚Äôs more inspiring than a natural-looking greenhouse with an important infrastructure and quality accommodation, all in the heart of Paris ? Powered by the Paris Innovation label, P√©pini√®re 27 is the ultimate friendly incubator with nearly 4 million euros raised by only 8 startups of the incubator.

In this friendly ecosystem, you have the choice between open or closed offices according to your needs, with a large common area free co-working, a waiting room, 9 meeting rooms fully equipped and relaxation areas (gym, patio). The team is composed of only 10 people with always a presence in the HQ.

An accompanying offer

Providing to startups an offer of hosting to work is something great, but an incubator would not be an incubator if it did not offer a continuous support. Thus, P√©pini√®re 27 offers business workshops, networking meetings, conferences, networking with experts in your field, as well as an access to a social platform bringing together all incubated startups.

P√©pini√®re 27 offers 3 programs for startups. Offices open starting at 560‚Ç¨/month (+ fees) or private (starting at 680‚Ç¨/month + fees) with the possibility of joining the Associate Program, allowing you to get :

  • A postal address at 27 rue du Chemin Vert (Paris 75011) with the management of your receptions and mailings stamped.
  • A permanent access badge to the premises (24h/24 and 7/7)
  • An access to the meeting rooms for the reception of your customers (according to availability)
  • A permanent access to the gym room
  • An access to the cafeteria
  • A profile of your company on the P√©pini√®re 27‚Äôs intranet (news feed, events, meeting rooms booking, chat, ‚Ä¶)

Certified Paris Innovation by the City of Paris

As a Paris Innovation certified incubator by the Paris City Hall, startups located in P√©pini√®re 27 can apply for a funding with Paris Innovation Amor√ßage funding program. Created to support the development of startups hosted in incubators labeled Paris Innovation, it is aimed at any innovative project in the seed or development phase. Do not hesitate to consult the detailed presentation of this program and to contact, as the case may be, the Paris Regional Office of Bpifrance √éle de France.

To learn more about P√©pini√®re 27, the reception is open from 9am to 6:30pm, if you want to have a preview of the atmosphere and the place, don‚Äôt hesitate to go there. It‚Äôs only 5 minutes from the Place de la Bastille !

üåê Contact üåê
P√©pini√®re 27
27 Rue du chemin vert
75013 Paris
+33 (0)1 75 77 87 00
contact@pepiniere27.fr
entry.summary: With more than 100 startups incubated in a general and multi-disciplinary ecosystem, P√©pini√®re 27 is a Parisian incubator offering both a flexible hosting and support services, but also a rich and inspiring infrastructure, like a natural greenhouse where knowledge flourishes.
